title: toml bindings documentation not possible to understand
body:
I'm trying to configure mouse and keyboard binds in the new toml format. I have converted it using `alacritty migrate` from my yml config from before, but it creates a separate heading for every single key bind and this is not practical. 

In reviewing the docs, 

```
Example: [keyboard]++ bindings = [++ { key = "N", mods = "Control|Shift", action = "CreateNewWindow" },++ { key = "L", mods = "Control|Shift", chars = "l" },++ ]
```

```
See _keyboard.bindings_ for full documentation on _mods_, _mode_, _action_,
and _chars_.

When an application running within Alacritty captures the mouse, the `Shift`
modifier can be used to suppress mouse reporting. If no action is found for
the event, actions for the event without the `Shift` modifier are triggered
instead.

*mouse* = _"Middle"_ | _"Left"_ | _"Right"_ | _"Back"_ | _"Forward"_ | _<integer>_

	Mouse button which needs to be pressed to trigger this binding.

*action* = *<keyboard.bindings.action>* | _"ExpandSelection"_

	*ExpandSelection*
		Expand the selection to the current mouse cursor location.

Example:
	*[mouse]*++
```

I wish I had something more helpful or specific to say but honestly none of this documentation really makes any sense. All the components we're used to seeing before are here but it's shocking to find lacking here a concrete example, only abstract symbolic examples. In particular it is not understood what `++` means. 

My simple attempt to bind mouse buttons results in failure: 

```
[mouse]
hide_when_typing = true
bindings = [ { mouse = "Middle", action = "PasteSelection" }, { mouse = "Back", chars = "abc" } ]
```

from logfile:
```
[13.304506648s] [ERROR] [alacritty_config_derive] Config error: duplicate field `mouse`
                                                  ; ignoring binding
```
